beneish_m_score.name: Beneish M-Score
beneish_m_score.how_to_check: Calculate from financials or use screening tool

altman_z_score.name: Altman Z-Score
altman_z_score.how_to_check: Calculate from financials or use screening tool

telecom_media.rationale: Z-Score designed for manufacturing. Telecom/media have asset-light models with negative working capital by design. Use Piotroski F-Score and debt service metrics as validation.

biotech_pharma.rationale: R&D-heavy companies have lower working capital ratios and negative earnings during development. Evaluate cash runway instead.

software_saas.rationale: Negative working capital is normal for subscription models with deferred revenue. High margins support debt servicing.

utilities.rationale: High leverage is normal and serviceable due to regulated cash flows.

financials_banks.rationale: Z-Score formula inapplicable. Use Tier 1 Capital Ratio (>8%), NPL ratio (<3%), and regulatory capital requirements.

altman_z_score.implementation_note: When company's industry requires adjusted threshold, use both: (1) Adjusted threshold for Z-Score, (2) Validation metrics to confirm financial health. Example: CMCSA Z-Score 1.53 fails standard 1.81 but passes telecom 1.5 AND has Piotroski 9 + interest coverage 5.3x.

hostile_deal.name: Hostile Deal
hostile_deal.how_to_check: Check deal announcement, target board response

macro_conflict.name: Macro Conflict
macro_conflict.fail_condition: Rate/commodity sensitivity conflicts with legislative thesis
macro_conflict.rationale: Enphase/Albemarle pattern - macro overwhelms legislative tailwind

examples.conflict: Lithium price exposure overwhelmed legislative tailwind

macro_conflict.how_to_check: Identify company's macro sensitivities, check if they conflict with thesis

market_cap_ceiling.name: Market Cap Ceiling
market_cap_ceiling.rationale: Framework targets underappreciated special situations. Mega-caps ($50B+) are widely-analyzed institutional plays with lower opportunity density and reduced insider edge.

merger_arb.rationale: More liquid markets support larger positions

market_cap_ceiling.how_to_check: Get latest market cap from financial data provider (Yahoo Finance, SEC filing, or calculate shares_outstanding * current_price)

pdufa_financial_health.name: PDUFA Financial Health
pdufa_financial_health.rationale: PDUFA candidates need runway to survive approval delays, commercialization costs, and potential clinical failure. Generic Z-Score misses biotech-specific risks.

screens.rationale: Need 18+ months to cover (1) PDUFA delay, (2) CRL resubmission, or (3) pivot to alternative program
High leverage limits strategic flexibility if approval delayed or rejected
screens.note: Ignore if equity is negative (auto-fail on Z-Score anyway)

screens.rationale: Need 50%+ gross margin to support SG&A and commercialization costs post-approval
screens.note: Skip for pure-play development companies with no revenue

screens.rationale: Net debt signals distress and limited financial flexibility

pdufa_financial_health.how_to_check: Extract from latest 10-Q or 10-K. Calculate cash runway using operating cash flow burn rate.
pdufa_financial_health.critical_note: ALL sub-screens must pass. Any single fail = automatic PASS decision.

fail.result: FAIL - Runway 4.9mo << 18mo threshold. Z-Score -5.39 already failed.

insider_cluster_quality.name: Insider Cluster Quality
insider_cluster_quality.fail_condition: Fewer than 3 opportunistic insiders in cluster
insider_cluster_quality.rationale: Routine traders eliminate ~50% of false signals. Only count opportunistic traders toward cluster threshold.
insider_cluster_quality.how_to_check: Pull 3-year Form 4 history for each insider. Classify as routine if trades occur in same calendar month annually (3+ years). Count only opportunistic traders toward 3+ threshold.

routine_trader_definition.pattern: Trades occur in same calendar month annually
routine_trader_definition.example: Insider sells every June for 3+ years = routine. Exclude from cluster count.

implementation.analysis: For each insider in cluster: fetch Form 4s from past 3 years, extract transaction dates, check for annual calendar month pattern. If pattern detected, exclude insider from cluster count.

pass.scenario: 5 insider purchases in 2-week window: 4 opportunistic + 1 routine

fail.scenario: 5 insider purchases in 2-week window: 2 opportunistic + 3 routine

logic: Any kill screen fail = automatic PASS. Check ALL applicable screens BEFORE scoring.
